instructions:
Fry bacon until crisp in a large skillet and set bacon aside. Secure outer leaves of each cabbage wedge
with a toothpick. Add cabbage wedges, onion, water, sugar and all the spices to the bacon drippings. Cook
covered 30 minutes at low/warm turning cabbage wedges at least once. Add Kielbasa and continue cooking
covered an additional 10 to 15 minutes or until cabbage is at desired tenderness. Do not allow to cook dry,
add water as needed. Top with crumbled bacon. Serve with salt-water potatoes and a pat of butter. Serves 6.
ingredients: 1 head cabbage (2 lb) cut in 8 wedges
1 lb Polish Kielbasa, cut in 6 pieces (3 inches each)
name: Kielbasa And Cabbage
creator: Jim Decker
